titles: All the examinacions of the constante martir of God M. Iohn Bradforde before the Lorde Chauncellour, B. of Winchester the B. of London, [and] other co[m]missioners: whervnto ar annexed, his priuate talk [and] conflictes in prison after his condemnacion, with the Archbishop of york, the B. of Chichester, Alfonsus, and King Philips confessour, two Spanishe freers, and sundry others. With his modest learned and godly answeres. Anno. Domini 1561
author: Bradford, John, 1510?-1555.
publisher: In Fleetstrete, at the signe of [the] faucon by William Griffith, and are to be sold at the litle shop in saincte Dunstones churchyard,
notes: Signatures: * [par.] [4 dots] [hand] a A⁴ B-I K⁶.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
